IPlayer Namespace Reference

The interface a player plug-in has to implement, so the Player singleton can use it for playing a media file. More...


Functions

void open (ref Media media)
 Opens a media file and optionally updates some information in the media object, which was discovered after opening the file.
void play ()
 Start playing the previously opened media object.
void stop ()
 Stops the playback.
void setPaused (bool state)
 Pauses or unpauses the playback.
bool getPaused ()
 Returns whether the playback has been paused.
void setMuted (bool state)
 Mutes or unmutes the sound.
bool getMuted ()
 Returns whether the sound has been muted.
void setPosition (float position)
 Seeks to the specified position.
float getPosition ()
 Returns the current playback position.
void setVolume (float volume)
 Sets the current volume.
float getVolume ()
 Returns the current volume.
void tick ()
 Should get called about every 250ms.
bool getIsFading ()
 Returns whether the plug-in is crossfading between two tracks at the moment.
void setFadetime (int ft)
 Sets the time two tracks should get crossfaded.
void setPicshowtime (int pic)
 Sets the time a picture should get shown (because a picture has no defined length on its own).

Detailed Description

The interface a player plug-in has to implement, so the Player singleton can use it for playing a media file.

Function Documentation

float IPlayer::getPosition (  ) 

Returns the current playback position.

Returns:
Playback position in milliseconds

float IPlayer::getVolume (  ) 

Returns the current volume.

Returns:
Volume between 0 and 100

void IPlayer::open ( ref Media  media  ) 

Opens a media file and optionally updates some information in the media object, which was discovered after opening the file.

Parameters:
media The media object which should get opened

void IPlayer::setFadetime ( int  ft  ) 

Sets the time two tracks should get crossfaded.

Parameters:
ft Fadetime in milliseconds

void IPlayer::setMuted ( bool  state  ) 

Mutes or unmutes the sound.

Parameters:
state true = mute, false = unmute

void IPlayer::setPaused ( bool  state  ) 

Pauses or unpauses the playback.

Parameters:
state true = pause, false = unpause

void IPlayer::setPicshowtime ( int  pic  ) 

Sets the time a picture should get shown (because a picture has no defined length on its own).

Parameters:
pic The time the picture should get shown in milliseconds

void IPlayer::setPosition ( float  position  ) 

Seeks to the specified position.

Parameters:
position The position in milliseconds

Sets the current volume.

Parameters:
volume Volume between 0 and 100

void IPlayer::tick (  ) 

Should get called about every 250ms.

Allows the plug-in to do several things, like crossfading or similar
